attributes.action: Now recognise, with the award of a posthumous Victoria Cross, the debt owed to Jack Simpson Kirkpatrick in giving his life after saving over 300 of his comrades during the conflict which became known as Anzac Cove, Gallipoli.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Jack Simpson Kirkpatrick was born in South Shields on 6th July 1892 and who, after saving the lives of over 300 men at Gallipoli, was mortally wounded on 25th April 1915 and died 19th May 1915.
